passages.name: Brine Supplies
passages.text: <>Cheap Brines        A line of cheap brines sits on a shelf. You see: <> [[An appealing tub of rice vinegar|Rice Vinegar Grab]] <>[[A murky jar of saline|Saline Grab]]<> [[A small jar for pickling|Pickling Grab]]<><> [[An aromatic extra-wide jar of marinade.|Marinade Grab]] <> [[Back|Bonnets and Brines]] <><><>

links.text: An appealing tub of rice vinegar
An aromatic extra-wide jar of marinade.

passages.name: Stock Room Jumble 2 Search
passages.text:
<><>
Mound of Boxes
The mountainous pile before you contains many boxes of sandals but none of the kind your customer is looking for. Separate from the rest, an [[open shoe box|Stock Room Open Shoe Box]] rests at your feet. [[Wait a moment.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Wait Intro]] <>[[Take one of the decorated shoes.|Take Bedazzled Shoe]]<>[[Swap out your decorated shoe for another one.|Take Bedazzled Shoe]]<> [[Leave the pile.|Stock Room 2]] <><><>

destination.name: Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Wait Intro

links.text: Take one of the decorated shoes.
Swap out your decorated shoe for another one.

passages.name: Mall Entrance Nothing
passages.text: The back of the [[soda machine|Mall Entrance Soda Machine]] has become something of a holy site for the local black ants. Them and [[a swarm of flies.|Mall Entrance 2]]

passages.name: Rewind
passages.text: <html><style>#passages {background-color:#000000; width:700px; font:56px arial; margin-top:32px;} .passage {text-align:center;} a:link{color:#FFFFFF !important; text-decoration:none !important;} a:visited{color:#FFFFFF !important; text-decoration:none !important;} a:hover {color:#AAAAAA !important; text-decoration:none !important;}</style></html>\n[[Part 1|Time Clock 1]]\n

passages.name: Rice Vinegar Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the jar [[in your handbag.|Brine Supplies]] <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Take Bedazzled Shoe Left
passages.text: <>\nYou take the thong sandal, [[a left shoe.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search]]\n

passages.name: Exam Room Sit
passages.text: \n"Hopefully this works better this time," your handler says and points the controller at your feet, causing your left foot to jump. Before he jogs back to the conference room, he <>wipes off your chin with his sleeve and [[smiles reassuringly.|Exam Room Sitting]]<>pats you on the knee and [[smiles reassuringly.|Exam Room Sitting]]<>

passages.name: Costume Dinosaur
passages.text: <>Lacy Triceratops Costume        A bizarre triceratops headpiece fringed with delicate white lace slides into view, attached to a silky ballgown. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <><><><>

passages.name: Warehouse Run
passages.text: \nYou jog then run down the loading bay. The only thing that stops you is the garage door, where the light pouring in from outside is radiant. You have an image in your mind of the rolling manuever you'd like to perform, but you instead end up kneeling down and slowly falling over. [[It works.|Part Three]]\n

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door 2
passages.text: <>Sales Office Door        A sign says, "Lower Level Sales Office." [[Open the door.|Stock Room Closed Door 2 Open]] [[Knock on the door.|Stock Room Closed Door 2 Knock]] [[Peer under the door.|Stock Room Closed Door 2 Peer]] [[Back|Stock Room 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Intro 4
passages.text: Vandar leans around the corner to glance at you, and as you turn back to the pile, you see the shoe. How did you miss it? You breathe a sigh of relief. [[Take the shoe.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Intro 5]]

passages.name: Blessed Office Small Door 2
passages.text: \nYou open the door and peek inside. You could squeeze into the little cubby you find, but attempting an escape with your shoes activated [[seems foolhardy.|Blessed Office 3]]\n

passages.name: Blessed Office Small Door 3
passages.text: You jam yourself into the cubby and close the door behind you. A half dozen illuminated buttons are unlabeled except for one. [["Shoe Dept."|Elevator Ride]]

passages.name: Empty Office
passages.text:
<>
Empty Office
You're [[seated|Empty Office Standing Up]] in a hard chair next to an [[empty table|Empty Table]] in a room about the size and proportions of a prison cell. Across from you is a [[metal desk,|Empty Office Can't Reach]] and to the right is a [[gray door.|Empty Office Can't Reach]] High up in the corner is a rather new-looking security camera with multiple cables hanging unplugged. You're wearing [[New Shoes.|New Shoes]] You must be. They've shaded themselves khaki to match your business casual pants, but there's still something strange about their appearance. <><><>

passages.name: Empty Office Desk
passages.text: \nYou rifle through the drawers. They're filled with ancient Braxxton's documents related to hot plate recalls and employee turnover rates. Near the bottom of a stack, you find a clean white sheet bearing the Sunrise letterhead (glowing brain, firm serif lettering). This page has been misplaced, or left behind, and was [[clearly taken from a longer handwritten narrative.|Desk Note]]\n

links.text: clearly taken from a longer handwritten narrative.

passages.name: Heather Jumble Run 2
passages.text: She smiles, and you both hear Vandar swear. "I'm not making excuses!" he yells. [["OK."|Front Counter Room 2]]

passages.name: Hair Treatments Question
passages.text: <>He looks at your bulging jacket. "Would you mind emptying what's inside your coat?" he says. You pull out the small collection of styling supplies and drop it on the counter. "Were you going to pay for those, sir?" the associate says. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>He smiles. "Look for the shampoo pyramid," he says and points. "They're just past it." [["Thanks."|Hair Treatments]]<><>"There's a great big display," he says and points, "just past the pyramid of shampoos." [["Thanks."|Hair Treatments]]<>

passages.name: Heather Jumble Run
passages.text: "You're not the only one." [["What do you mean?"|Heather Jumble Run 2]]

passages.name: Styling Supplies
passages.text: <>Cheap Styling Supplies        Hair styling implements hang from small pegs. You see: <> [[A miniature curling iron|Curling Iron Grab]] <>[[A broken comb|Comb Grab]]<> [[A large-toothed hair pick|Hair Pick Grab]]<><> [[A case containing hairpins|Hairpins Grab]]<> [[Back|Hair Treatments]] <><><>

passages.name: Waiting Room Phone Book
passages.text: <> You [[can't get close enough.|Waiting Room]] <> You grab the cell phone and phone book. [[Call your parents.|Dial Parents]] [[Call Yipp again.|YippTwo 1]] <> [[Dial 911.|Dial 9-1-1]] [[Back|Waiting Room]] <> [[Back|Waiting Room]] <> <>

passages.name: Exam Room
passages.text:
<><>
Examination Room
This room is like a cross between the world's smallest shoe store and a doctor's office. Shelves are jammed with a rainbow of shoe styles and colors and a wide selection of nylon socks. To the side, a pair of movable mirrors and a [[table|Exam Room Table]] heaped with controllers add to the clutter. Nearby, an extendable light angles down over an examination table. [[One door|Bustling Hallway]] leads to a busy hallway, and a [[second|Exam Room Locked Door]] to the Sunrise-requisitioned sector of the administrative wing. <><><><>

passages.name: Shopper Convo 2 Cart
passages.text: <> "Begone!" the woman yells, and you [[step back.|Shopper Convo 2]] <><> With the woman distracted, you take a closer look. The angular objects inside have seams and are marked with symbols that shimmer under the store's fluorescent lighting. The cart has a [[handle|Shopper Cart Handle]] and [[two back wheels.|Shopper Back Wheels]] [[Back|Shopper Convo 2]] <><> The objects inside have seams and are marked with strange, shimmering symbols. The cart has a [[handle|Shopper Cart Handle]] and [[two back wheels.|Shopper Back Wheels]] [[Back|Shopper Convo 2]] <>

passages.name: Fishing Supplies
passages.text: <>Cheap Fishing Supplies        Fishing gear hangs from small pegs. You see: <>[[A large lead weight|Lead Weight Grab]] <>[[A pockmarked bobber|Bobber Grab]]<> [[A minnow-sized lure|Minnow Lure Grab]]<><> [[A pair of fishing pliers|Fishing Pliers Grab]] <> [[Back|Sporting Goods]] <><><>

passages.name: Cafeteria Counter
passages.text: <> You wait in line, and when it's your turn, the main fruit cup guy points to your shirt. "You from Braxxton's?" he says. "We only serve Sunrise." [["Sorry."|Cafeteria]] <> <> You wait in line, but a worker [[waves you away.|Cafeteria]] "Six hours between servings," he says. <> <>You wait in line, and when it's your turn, a worker [[tosses you a fruit cup.|Cafeteria]] <><>

passages.name: Time Clock 1
passages.text:
<> -- <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> -- <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> <> -- <>
June, 1995. You're 15 years old, and you would have liked to while away the summer floating along on a breeze of hyperviolent video games and imaginary sex, [[but your parents wouldn't hear of it.|Time Clock 2]]

links.text: but your parents wouldn't hear of it.

passages.name: Time Clock 3
passages.text: \nIts recent troubles with tremors (geological anomolies, they say) and power outages don't mean much to you or your parents. Not even when you land the big job: Sales Associate I at Braxxton's Department Store, the oldest, crappiest, most retro-futurist retailer in the Northeast, a place of bland blues and faded golds. It looks a bit like the old Starship Enterprise, if it [[had appeared in a Sears catalog.|Time Clock 4]]\n

links.text: had appeared in a Sears catalog.

passages.name: Time Clock 2
passages.text: \nWhy don't you apply at the mall, they said. It's so close. Your family's Tudor home and subdivision adjoin an area of sprawl and restaurants and stuff, including the Red River Mall, which is large, complex, and branching, and named after a nearby waterway. [[Anything to get your foot in the door.|Time Clock 3]]\n

links.text: Anything to get your foot in the door.

passages.name: Time Clock 5
passages.text: <>Important-Looking Slot        It appears to have been designed for the insertion and sliding of a very thin card. <><><>

passages.name: Time Clock 4
passages.text:
<>
Break Room
You fidgit nervously in your 97% polyester Braxxton's Dept. Store shirt, which is brown and white-collared and has chipped snaps in place of buttons. You wonder how many tens of Sales Associate I's have worn it. It's 8:59, T-minus one minute and counting to the beginning of your shift and the passing of everything fun and innocent about your childhood.<> You're still waiting.<> 9:00 arrives. The time clock has an [[important-looking slot|Time Clock 5]] on its side, and a few of your fellow brown-shirted employees have gathered behind you in a line.<> "Cherubic," someone mumbles. <><><>

passages.name: Conference Room Stool
passages.text:
<><>
Conference Room
You're sitting in the corner, on a stool. <>And foaming a bit.<><>And foam is running down your chin.<><>And you're a mess.<> <>"The verbal control routine is the last major piece of the puzzle," your handler says, "and as you can see, it's coming along nicely." A hand goes up. "How close is the biological matrix to pushing the 2.5 megabyte goal established after the last demonstration?"<><>"Painfully close. The sub-dermis is now conducting upwards of 2.2 megabytes." A woman you remember from Employee Orientation raises her hand. "Being on the Braxxton's side of this project, I've seen so many of these benchmarks come and go in the past six months while receiving very little information as to how close we are to a salable product."<><>"I understand," your handler says, "and we appreciate how accepting your staff has been of Sunrise's procedures related to secrecy." "I also need to ask," she continues, "if this project is in any way connected to a government agency. I know you've answered this question before."<><>The woman at the head of the table looks up. "Which agency would that be?" she says. "I suppose any department or agency." "Then perhaps the Red River Health Dept."<><>Your handler waves the controller at you, and you stand up. "We have a right to know," the Braxxton's employee says, "if anyone, including the federal government, is involved." "Sure," the other woman says. "The conspiracy goes straight to the top."<> <>"Right this way," your handler says and pushes the [[door open.|Conference Room Leave]]<>[[Listen.|Conference Room Stool]] [[Gurgle.|Conference Room Gurgle]]<> <><><><>

passages.name: Police 2
passages.text: "Do you sell these?" he asks the associate, who shakes his head. The cop gives you a funny look and [[tosses you the controller.|Police 3]]

passages.name: Police 3
passages.text: He escorts you, uncuffed, through the Mattresses Dept. to the parking lot entrance, where several sunglass- and body armor-wearing guards are standing around with sidearms, looking very serious. The cop nods to them, and you duck your head, getting more excited with every step. When you flop into the back of the cop's squad car, you're almost in tears. You reach down and [[switch off the shoes.|Police 4]]

passages.name: Police 4
passages.text: \nOnce you're on the road, you tell the cop everything, about the secret underground manufacturing facility, the megalomaniacal shoe engineer, the pitiable drones in the loading bay, the complete subversion of the entire department store, the self-aware prototypes that stalk the Shoe Dept., the wild-eyed Sales Manager you beaned, the tribe of Clothing Dept. employees who subsist on carbohydrates against all odds, and the terrible mistake the local retail market [[has just narrowly avoided making.|Police 5]]\n

passages.name: Police 5
passages.text: \nThe ride to the Red River Police Dept. only takes about five minutes from the mall, but that's more than enough time for Lt. Noel Brooks to conclude that this, obviously, is a 10-96. And what a story he's telling. Noel turns the car around just as you're getting into the twisted dynamics of the Yipp family, and did you mention this was only your first day? The town slides by [[in a blur.|Hospital]]\n

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door Peer
passages.text: \nAll you can tell is there's [[a light on inside.|Stock Room Closed Door]]\n

passages.name: Cafeteria Man 2.3
passages.text: He bats at your hand. "Please don't help yourself to any of her affection," he says. "I'm one of those Early Adopters who, after exposure to the first test build of the E Series Controller, suffered widespread neurological damage and now requires constant affection and reassurance." [["That's horrible."|Cafeteria Man 3]] [["You were injured?"|Cafeteria Man 3]]

passages.name: Cafeteria Man 2.2
passages.text: He pats the dog on the head. "If you would stop and think for a moment, you'd probably realize that I'm one of those Early Adopters who tested the E Series Controller extensively and now requires a constant source of affection and reassurance." He scratches the dog's ear. [["I had no idea."|Cafeteria Man 3]] [["You were injured?"|Cafeteria Man 3]]

passages.name: Cafeteria Man 2.1
passages.text: <> "Sure," he says and nods at your coat.<>"More or less," he says.<> "But I'm flotsam. I was one of the last 'Early Adopters,' as they called us, to test the E Series Controller." He pats the dog on the head. "It zapped me bad, and now I require constant affection. I'm about to pet this poor dog bald." [["That's horrible."|Cafeteria Man 3]] [["You were injured?"|Cafeteria Man 3]]

passages.name: Empty Office Door Open
passages.text: <> Your hand won't go [[anywhere near the doorhandle.|Empty Office Door]] <> Your right hand feels much stronger, but the doorhandle keeps [[slipping through your fingers.|Empty Office Door 2]] <>

passages.name: Conference Room Look at Table
passages.text:
<>
Several men and women, most of them wearing red Sunrise hoodies, sit hunched over the table. At its head is an older woman in a gray pantsuit who's taking notes with a mechanical pencil. Her hair obscures her face. <> [[Look at your handler.|Conference Room Look at Handler]] [[Turn around.|Conference Room Turn Around]] <> Your handler twists a knob, and your legs hobble you over [[to a stool.|Conference Room Stool]] <>

passages.name: Blessed Office 4
passages.text:
<>
High-Tech Office
A fair amount of money went into outfitting this place in a nautical theme. Behind the large, curving desk is a [[small door.|Blessed Office Small Door 3]] The owner of this office is temporarily away. <><><>

passages.name: Blessed Office 2
passages.text:
<>
High-Tech Office
An aquarium burbles next to a mounted captain's wheel and a rusted anchor. Man size computer towers flank a curving desk and a double-wide leather chair. Behind the desk is a [[small door,|Blessed Office Small Door]] as if for a dumbwaiter. "Well?" she says. [[Sit down.|Blessed Office Seated 1]] <><><>

passages.name: Blessed Office 3
passages.text:
<><>
High-Tech Office
An aquarium burbles next to a mounted captain's wheel and a rusted anchor. Man-sized computer towers flank a curving desk and a double-wide leather chair. Behind the desk is a [[small door,|Blessed Office Small Door 2]] as if for a dumbwaiter. The owner of this office is temporarily away. <><><>

passages.name: New Shoes Force
passages.text: \nYou try with your hands and your opposite foot, but the New Shoes are [[firmly attached.|New Shoes]]\n

passages.name: Police
passages.text: "Please wait here," the associate says and picks up a phone. "Hello, this is Braxxton's Department Store, and I would like to report an attempted theft." You set down your <>cane<><>motorcycle helmet<><>handbag<>. "Please take a seat," the associate says and points to a stool. When the Red River cop arrives some 45 minutes later, he searches you and finds the controller. [["That's mine," you say.|Police 2]]

passages.name: Dial 9-1-1
passages.text:
<>
It rings twice. "9-1-1," a woman says. "What's your emergency?" [["I'm being held against my will by a pair of mind- and body-controlling running shoes."|Dial 9-1-1 2]] [["Someone needs to send out an immediate warning nationwide about a diabolical new brand of footwear. This is not a test."|Dial 9-1-1 2]] [["Send all available units to Braxxton's Shoe Dept., and someone who can reverse engineer advanced technologies."|Dial 9-1-1 2]] [["A rogue element has taken over part of the Red River Mall, and they have the power of mind control."|Dial 9-1-1 2]]

links.text: "I'm being held against my will by a pair of mind- and body-controlling running shoes."
"Someone needs to send out an immediate warning nationwide about a diabolical new brand of footwear. This is not a test."
"Send all available units to Braxxton's Shoe Dept., and someone who can reverse engineer advanced technologies."
"A rogue element has taken over part of the Red River Mall, and they have the power of mind control."

passages.name: Warehouse Walk
passages.text: \nYou straighten your sport coat and amble down the loading bay. Nobody seems to notice you walking in the half-dark. In as casual a motion as you can make it, you duck under the door [[and into the light.|Part Three]]\n

passages.name: Pass Out 8
passages.text: She puts whatever it is in her pocket. "I was just dizzy," you say. "I forgot to eat breakfast." Heather seems to buy it, and you [[ask to get on with the training.|Friday Outro 1]]

links.text: ask to get on with the training.

passages.name: Costume Chef
passages.text: <>Chef du Cereal Costume        A stringer of chrome cooking implements, all of them spoons, jingles into view, attached to a tin-foil chef's hat. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <><><><>

passages.name: Pass Out 5
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
"No," she says, "and it's probably for the best." [[You try to stand.|Pass Out 6]] <><><>

passages.name: Pass Out 4
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
"I'll do it," she says and crosses her arms. "Vandar just stormed out of the department." [["Did the customer get his shoes?"|Pass Out 5]] <><><>

passages.name: Pass Out 7
passages.text: \nHeather strolls up to the front counter and comes back carrying a small device, but it's [[too dark to tell what it is.|Pass Out 8]]\n

links.text: too dark to tell what it is.

passages.name: Pass Out 6
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
You succeed and look back at the mound of shoe boxes. It's as you left it, minus the shoe-creature. "What happened?" Heather says. [[You feign confusion.|Pass Out 7]] <><><>

passages.name: Pass Out 3
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
"Why did you have that shoehorn in your pocket?" [["Um, I was going to put it back."|Pass Out 4]] <><><>

links.text: "Um, I was going to put it back."

passages.name: Pass Out 2
passages.text:
<><><>
Stock Room
You're sitting on the floor. "Should I call 911?" Heather says, but you shake your head. [["I'm OK."|Pass Out 3]] <><><>

passages.name: stylesheet
Heather Sandals
passages.text: "There was something I wanted to talk to you about," you say. Heather looks at you. [["Where are the lady's beach sandals?"|Heather Followup 3.1]] <>[["What exactly does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Heather Followup 1.1]] [["How long have you worked here?"|Heather Followup 2.1]]<><>[["What exactly does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Heather Followup 1.1]]<><>[["How long have you worked here?"|Heather Followup 2.1]] [["Remind me, what does Ken the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Heather Followup 1.2]]<><>[["Remind me, what does Ken the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Heather Followup 1.2]]<> <>[["I just saw something strange in the stock room."|Heather Jumble Run]]<>

links.text: "What exactly does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"
"Remind me, what does Ken the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"
"I just saw something strange in the stock room."

passages.name: Shopper Old Woman
passages.text: \nShe's of average height, and her gray hair is tied back with a purple ribbon. Her dark overalls have [[patches on the knees.|Lower Level Shopper 2]]\n

passages.name: Beach Sandals Room
passages.text:
<>
Beach Sandals Section
A shelf holds all of the lady's Beach Sandals that the department sells, which isn't many. The [[customer|Sandals Customer]] who wants a style with blue butterflies around the toe straps is <> You can find your way back to the [[front counter|Front Counter Room 2]] from here. That's where Heather has positioned herself. <><><>

passages.name: Stock Room Vandar 2
passages.text: He covers the phone. "Not now," he says. [[You nod.|Stock Room 2]]

passages.name: Clothing Makeover
passages.text: You hand off the controller to a long-haired Clothing employee who leads you over to a clothing rack and pulls out three different outfits. His colleague shows up to sprinkle the garments with accessories and other items and arrange them just so on a table for your review. After a few minutes, they say in unison, "Pick." [[Straw hat, pleated slacks, pinkish corsage, hickory cane|Makeover Old Man]] [[Leather jacket, crucifix earing, metal band t-shirt, motorcycle helmet|Makeover Dude]] [[Floral-patterned dress, cream bonnet, handbag, beaded necklace|Makeover Lady]]

links.text: Straw hat, pleated slacks, pinkish corsage, hickory cane
Leather jacket, crucifix earing, metal band t-shirt, motorcycle helmet
Floral-patterned dress, cream bonnet, handbag, beaded necklace

passages.name: Lower Level 2
passages.text:
<>
Lower Level
A walkway leads to the [[Shoe Dept.,|Lower Level Shopper]] located against the far wall. Hundreds of racks of clothes form convoluted jungles of discounted merchandise. You'd start to explore but [[might get lost.|Lower Level Might Get Lost]] <><><>

passages.name: Lower Level Shopper
passages.text: You head for the Shoe Department, but an [[old woman|Shopper Old Woman]] lurches in front of your path. "Blessed!" she says and releases her shopping cart's handle, which causes a plastic bag to slide into the crook of her arm with a terrible, clattering racket. The shopping cart, which rolls to a stop, contains several [[gray, angular objects.|Shopper Square]] [["Do you need help?"|Shopper Help]]

passages.name: Heather Final
passages.text: She looks at you quizzically. The elevator rattles. Someone's right behind you. You bolt for the [[front counter.|Sales Manager Encounter]]

passages.name: New Shoes
passages.text: <>New Shoes        They're wrapped tightly around your feet, which feel perfectly ventilated and supported. The shoes' surface is tan-colored and covered with small bumps and ridges. [[Untie them.|New Shoes Untie]] [[Force them off.|New Shoes Force]] <> [[Back|Empty Office]] <> [[Back|Empty Office Standing]] <> <><><>

passages.name: Shopper Square
passages.text: \nThey're [[square, oblong, all shapes, and studded with sharp angles.|Lower Level Shopper 2]]\n

links.text: square, oblong, all shapes, and studded with sharp angles.

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 3 Pronounce
passages.text:
<>
And action. "<>" <>[[More words, more words.|Conference Room Speech 4]]<>"C'mon," your handler whispers and [[fiddles with his controller.|Conference Room Speech 3]]<>

passages.name: Stock Room Jumble
passages.text: <>You approach but [[back away|Stock Room]] when something dark scurries between your legs. <> You approach but [[back away|Stock Room]] when something dark scurries between your legs. "I hate those things," Heather says.<>

passages.name: Bare Room Blessed 6.2
passages.text: "The government does a damn good job at being wrong most of the time," she says, "and that's not good enough for us. To most people aware of our existence, we're a subcontractor of a subcontractor of a subcontractor. Nobody, really. Once the New Shoe goes public, we'll discard the Sunrise name and take on a new identity." [["Why are you tell me this?"|Bare Room Blessed 7.1]] [["Nonsense. We're sitting in Braxxton's crummy basement, and you're talking about a machine to end free society."|Bare Room Blessed 7.2]]

links.text: "Nonsense. We're sitting in Braxxton's crummy basement, and you're talking about a machine to end free society."

passages.name: Bare Room Blessed 6.1
passages.text: "Nobody but us. To most people aware of our existence, we're a subcontractor of a subcontractor of a subcontractor. Once the New Shoe goes public, we'll discard the Sunrise name and take on a new identity." [["Why are you tell me this?"|Bare Room Blessed 7.1]] [["Nonsense. We're sitting in Braxxton's crummy basement, and you're talking about a machine to end free society."|Bare Room Blessed 7.2]]

links.text: "Nonsense. We're sitting in Braxxton's crummy basement, and you're talking about a machine to end free society."

passages.name: Use Controller
passages.text:
<<set $shoesdeactivate="yes">><html><style>#passages{background-color:#000000;margin-left:20%;}</style></html>
It clicks into place. You wait.
<<timedcontinue 3s>>
Nothing yet.
<<timedcontinue 3s>>
Maybe you felt something.
<<timedcontinue 3s>>
No, no, false alarm.
<<timedcontinue 3s>>
Wait, you did feel something. You feel like you're coming back together.
<<timedcontinue 3.5s>>
Your mind clears, and you [[stand up.|Exam Room]] Your legs feel stronger.

passages.name: Shepherd Crook
passages.text: <>   You carefully  [[dislodge the sport coat|Use Crook]]     <> <>   A sturdy cane for corralling sheep.    <>   Careful where you point that.    <> <>

passages.name: Hairpins Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the case [[in your jacket pocket.|Styling Supplies]] <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Empty Office Door Hands Up
passages.text: [[You curse rather loudly|Empty Office Standing]] and turn away from the door. The [[doorhandle|Empty Office Door Hands Up 2]] is now behind you.

passages.name: Yipp 1
passages.text: "Hello?" a voice says. It's her. [["Hello, I'm the employee from Braxxton's. We spoke a ..."|Yipp 2]]

links.text: "Hello, I'm the employee from Braxxton's. We spoke a ..."

passages.name: Waiting Room Take Copy
passages.text: \nYou lean in for a copy, but she [[beats you to it.|Waiting Room Box]]\n

passages.name: Cafeteria Food
passages.text: \nThere's only one option, small containers of what looks like [[purple fruit salad.|Cafeteria]]\n

passages.name: Mall Entrance 2
passages.text:
<>
Mall Entrance
There's [[nothing that exciting|Mall Entrance Nothing]] here, only a not-real plant and a [[soda machine.|Mall Entrance Soda Machine]] A nearby [[elevator|Elevator]] leads down to the Lower Level and the Shoe Department. <><><>

passages.name: Marinade Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the jar [[in your handbag.|Brine Supplies]] <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Stock Room Frog
passages.text: \nIt's [[cracked down the middle.|Stock Room Intro]]\n

passages.name: Exam Room Can't Reach
passages.text: \nYou can't reach it from [[where you're sitting.|Exam Room Sitting]]\n

passages.name: Warehouse Garage Doors
passages.text: <> Your legs are still [[too sluggish|Warehouse]] to attempt an escape. <> A breeze blows under the door, and you can smell freshly cut grass on the other side. [[Play it cool. Slip under the door like you belong here.|Warehouse Walk]] [[Run for it.|Warehouse Run]] <>

links.text: Play it cool. Slip under the door like you belong here.

passages.name: Marinade
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the tub of marinade  [[out of your handbag|Bonnets Busted]]     <>   Pieces of tomato and pepper swirl around in the jar.    <>

passages.name: Exam Room Table
passages.text: <> The controllers are in shambles. Nests of wire burst out of plastic housings perforated with blue buttons, tiddly-winks, and three-point switches. [[You wouldn't know where to begin.|Exam Room]] <> <> While many of the controllers are partially disassembled, you find a nice round one that has a small LCD screen and a Y etched into its back. [[Take it.|Take Controller]] [[Back|Exam Room]] <> The table is strewn with [[useless parts.|Exam Room]] <> <>

links.text: You wouldn't know where to begin.

passages.name: Shopper Convo 3
passages.text: <><><>"I can't let you take this," the woman says and leans forward to whisper. "Look me up in the phone book when you get home tonight, new guy. Maryann Yipp. Y-I-P-P. Don't forget." She straightens up. "Now give me some room, you two!" [[Step back.|Shopper Convo 2]]

passages.name: Shopper Convo 2
passages.text:
<><><><><><><><><><>
Mid-Aisle
<>The [[shopping cart|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] is now officially abandoned.<><>You're midway down the Lower Level's main runway.<><> The woman lays into the shopping cart again, but it won't budge. She struggles some more, swearing under her breath, and finally walks away, down the aisle to the elevator, where she punches the call button. The [[shopping cart|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] is now officially abandoned.<><><><>The woman grunts as she attempts to push the [[shopping cart|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] even a few feet. The angular objects resting inside must weigh a ton.<><>The woman is sweating, really struggling now as she yanks on the [[shopping cart.|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] It's not cooperating.<><> Exhausted, the woman has released the [[shopping cart|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] and is looking down, her expression blank.<><>Dazed, the woman stands next to the [[shopping cart.|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]]<> <> Nearby, you see the [[bag of shoehorns|Shopper Bag]] and a [[stray|Shopper Stray Shoehorn]] that has bounced off to the side, <> Nearby, you see the [[bag of shoehorns,|Shopper Bag]] <> <>and the aisle continues on to the [[Shoe Dept.|Shopper Ladies Shoes]]<><>and the aisle continues on to the [[Shoe Dept.|Shopper Ladies Shoes]] <><><>and the aisle continues on to the [[Shoe Dept.|Shopper Ladies Shoes]] Heather stands at the ready. "<>" she says.<> <>[[Wait.|Shopper Convo 2]] <><><><><> [["I need to take those containers to my manager."|Shopper Convo 3]] [[Wait.|Shopper Convo 2]] <><><><><><><><><>

links.text: "I need to take those containers to my manager."

passages.name: Makeover Dude
passages.text:
<>
"Dude," they say and show you to a changing room. When you're done, they come and kneel at your feet with the controller, arguing over what to activate and for how long. Finally, they instruct you to [[close your eyes.|Makeover Process]]

passages.name: Fishing Pliers
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the pliers  [[out of your pocket|Sporting Goods Busted]]     <>   A tool for un-hooking fish and performing other tasks.    <>

passages.name: Rice Vinegar
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the jar of vinegar  [[out of your handbag|Bonnets Busted]]     <>   It contains a small amount of mild vinegar.    <>

passages.name: Stock Room Final
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
The door to the Lower Level Sales Office has been kicked in, and the room stands empty except for a smashed computer console and what appears to be someone's overcoat. A doorway leads to the department's [[front counter,|Heather Final 2]] and the small elevator lies behind you, out of reach. Heather comes running back. "A gang of Clothing Dept. employees just stormed the stock room and took off with the New Shoe containers and the shopping cart they were in," she says. "They heaved it into the Discount Clothing Section. We'll never find it. By the way, where have you been?" [["Lost."|Heather Final]] [["I wish I could explain."|Heather Final]] <><><>

passages.name: Costume Clown Take Coat
passages.text: \nYou jump [[but can't reach it.|Costume Clown]]\n

passages.name: Stock Room Boxes 2 Search
passages.text: \nYou spend a few minutes rifling through the boxes [[but find no beach sandals.|Stock Room Boxes 2]]\n

passages.name: Drop Crook
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou toss the crook on the floor and [[head upstairs.|Waiting Room]]\n

passages.name: Costume Delinquent
passages.text: <>Adolescent Wolf Costume        The ensemble that rattles into view looks a lot like what you would normally wear, plus a wolf head. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <><><><>

passages.name: Hospital 2.5
passages.text: <html><style>#passages{background-color:#000000;margin-left:20%;}</style></html>\n"For now," she says, [["it's the best we can do."|Hospital 3]]\n

passages.name: Hair Treatments Associate
passages.text: <>Sales Associate        His name tag says "Norm Claude." "Can I help you with something, sir?" [["Uh, no."|Hair Treatments]] [["Do you have unbreakable combs?"|Hair Treatments Question]] <><><>

passages.name: Lower Level Sales Manager
passages.text: <>Lower Level Sales Manager        He looks hollowed out. Whatever he's been working on in that little office has been working on him, too. [[Back|Front Counter Final]] <><><>

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door 2 Open
passages.text: \nAs you suspected, [[it's locked.|Stock Room Closed Door 2]]\n

passages.name: Makeover Lady
passages.text:
<>
"Lady," they say and show you to a changing room. When you're done, they come and kneel at your feet with the controller, arguing over what to activate and for how long. Finally, they instruct you to [[close your eyes.|Makeover Process]]

passages.name: Pickling Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the jar [[in your handbag.|Brine Supplies]] <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door Open
passages.text: \nYou twist the handle but only [[make a grating sound.|Stock Room Closed Door]]\n

passages.name: Costume Lawyer
passages.text: <>Hot Pickin' Lawyer Costume        The business suit that slides into view has sequins along its lapels, and instead of a briefcase, there's a banjo. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <><><><>

passages.name: Waiting Room Cell Phone
passages.text: <> You [[can't get close enough.|Waiting Room]] <> You'd like to use it, [[but first you need a number to dial.|Waiting Room]] <>

links.text: but first you need a number to dial.

passages.name: Empty Office Can't Reach
passages.text: \nYou can't reach it from [[where you're sitting.|Empty Office]]\n

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door
passages.text: <>Sales Office Door        A sign reads, "Lower Level Sales Office." [[Open the door.|Stock Room Closed Door Open]] [[Knock on the door.|Stock Room Closed Door Knock]] [[Peer under the door.|Stock Room Closed Door Peer]] [[Back|Stock Room]] <><><>

passages.name: Black Again
passages.text:
<<set $havenametag="no">><html><style>#passages{background-color:#000000;margin-left:20%;}</style></html>

<<timedcontinue 5s>>Someone is fumbling with your feet.

<<timedcontinue 4s>>Whoever it is, you hope they don't notice the large plantar wart on the bottom of your left foot.

<<timedcontinue 5s>>You've been treating it with salicylic acid for months.

<<timedcontinue 3s>>[[You open your eyes.|Empty Office]]

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: The Shoe Dept.

passages.name: Upsilon Controller
passages.text: <> <>   You move over to the exam table and  [[press the yellow button|Use Controller]]     <>   You need a stable place to sit down and fiddle with this thing in private.    <> <>   You don't know what else to do with it.    <>

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door 2 Knock
passages.text: \nYou rap a couple times but [[hear no answer.|Stock Room Closed Door 2]]\n

passages.name: Clothing Leaving 2
passages.text: \nYou take up your <>cane<><>motorcycle helmet<><>handbag<> and follow the dog guy over to the [[main elevator.|Elevator Final]] "Goodbye," he says and sprints back into the racks.\n

passages.name: Blessed Office Small Door
passages.text: It's closed, but there doesn't appear to be any lock. [[Open it.|Blessed Office Small Door Open]] [[Back|Blessed Office 2]]

passages.name: Stock Room
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
Everywhere, shoeboxes. Around a corner, there's [[a messy area,|Stock Room Jumble]] and [[a more tidy section|Stock Room Boxes]] lies directly in front of you. To the right, a narrow hallway ends in [[a door|Stock Room Closed Door]] marked "Lower Level Sales Office," and some fifteen feet above [[a loft|Stock Room Loft]] extends into the wall and out of sight. [[Vandar|Stock Room Vandar]] <> and a doorway leads to the <>[[front counter.|Front Counter Bounce]]<>[[front counter.|Front Counter Room]]<> <>Heather is following you.<><>Heather is standing next to you with the cart full of New Shoe containers.<> <><><>

passages.name: Beach Sandals
passages.text: "I suppose," she says, so you cut a line to the customer. He's holding two large lady's sandals: one with a red stripe down the side and another decorated with blue butterflies. [["Looking for a present?" you say.|Beach Sandals 1.1]]

passages.name: Break Room
passages.text:
<>
Break Room
This corner of the administrative wing is ammonia scented, wood-paneled, and strangely devoid of coworkers. Under a stack of old store circulars, you find a fraying Red River County phone book and flip to the Y's. Yipp, Loren. Yipp, Maryann. That's it. You [[input the digits|Yipp 1]] into the old rotary phone in the corner. You think. <><><>

passages.name: Hairpins
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the hairpin case  [[out of your jacket|Hair Treatments Busted]]     <>   It contains a comprehensive selection of small pins and clamps.    <>

passages.name: Yipp Final 6.1
passages.text: "You can't change your height and general dimensions, just the general shape and texture of your features. I think. This has never really been attempted before." "Oh." "To get started, just say the code word 'Makeover.'" "Right now?" "To the Clothing employees." [["Makeover."|Clothing Makeover]]

passages.name: Yipp Final 6.2
passages.text: "Probably. This has never really been attempted before." "Oh." "To get started, just say the code word 'Makeover.'" "Right now?" "To the Clothing employees." [["Makeover."|Clothing Makeover]]

passages.name: End
passages.text: [[Rewind|Rewind]] ifcomp.org

passages.name: Yipp Final 4.2
passages.text: "You're lucky. Blessed worked in Great Britain, for the government, for a unit making space weapons for about a decade. You think that stuff stopped with Reagan? Not likely. After a while, she struck out on her own, raising money from a rogue's gallery of investors who insulated themselves from her methods but not the expected profits." [["I need to go home."|Yipp Final 5]]

passages.name: Yipp Final 4.1
passages.text: "Don't count her out of anything. She worked in Great Britain, for the government, for a unit making space weapons for about a decade. You think that stuff stopped with Reagan? Not likely. After a while, she struck out on her own, raising money from a rogue's gallery of investors who insulated themselves from her methods but not the expected profits." [["I need to go home."|Yipp Final 5]]
