passages.name: Lower Level Shopper 2
passages.text: An [[old woman|Shopper Old Woman]] and her shopping cart are standing in front of you. She appears to be in distress. The shopping cart contains [[gray, angular containers|Shopper Square]] the likes of which you've never seen before. [["Do you need help?"|Shopper Help]]

passages.name: Shopper Bag
passages.text: <>Bag of Shoehorns        There are about a dozen shoehorns in the plastic bag. [[Take one.|Take Shopper Bag]] [[Back|Shopper Convo 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Lower Level
passages.text:
<>
Lower Level
The high ceiling is shrouded in darkness, and the air feels strangely humid. A walkway cuts through the jumble down here and up to the [[shoe department.|Lower Level Shopper]] Hundreds of racks of clothes, garish sport jackets, a fantastical backlog of outdated merchandise, form twisting jungles that intermingle with dusty bric-a-brac and hunting gear. The Clothes and Gifts departments appear to have lost all sense of rows and racks, with blouses, billiard gloves, toy poodle desk ornaments and dark, feathery hats in tall plastic boxes bumping and overlapping in a stock associate’s waking nightmare. You'd explore further but [[might lose your way.|Lower Level Might Get Lost]] <><><>

passages.name: Costume Clown
passages.text: <>Weepy Clown Costume        <> A red wig, a maroon sport coat, and a yellow squirting-flower glide into view. [[Take the coat.|Costume Clown Take Coat]] [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <> A red wig and a yellow squirting-flower dangle from a lonely hook. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <> <><><>

passages.name: Conference Room Turn Around
passages.text:
<><>
On a whiteboard, someone has drawn a cross section of the New Shoe in all its complexity. It appears that the heel area contains the central processing unit, a dark octagon from which wires extend like tentacles. <> [[Look at the conference table.|Conference Room Look at Table]] [[Look at your handler.|Conference Room Look at Handler]] <> Your handler twists a knob, and your legs hobble you over [[to a stool.|Conference Room Stool]] <>

passages.name: Conference Room Gurgle
passages.text:
<><><>
Conference Room
You're sitting in the corner, on a stool. <>And foaming a bit.<><>And foam is running down your chin.<><>And you're a mess.<> <>"The verbal control routine is the last major piece of the puzzle," your handler says, "and as you can see, it's coming along nicely." A hand goes up. "How close is the biological matrix to pushing the 2.5 megabyte goal established after the last demonstration?"<><>"Painfully close. The sub-dermis is now conducting upwards of 2.2 megabytes." A woman you remember from Employee Orientation raises her hand. "Being on the Braxxton's side of this project, I've seen so many of these benchmarks come and go in the past six months while receiving very little information as to how close we are to a salable product."<><>"I understand," your handler says, "and we appreciate how accepting your staff has been of Sunrise's procedures related to secrecy." "I also need to ask," she continues, "if this project is in any way connected to a government agency. I know you've answered this question before."<><>The woman at the head of the table looks up. "Which agency would that be?" she says. "I suppose any department or agency." "Then perhaps the Red River Health Dept."<><>Your handler waves the controller at you, and you stand up. "We have a right to know," the Braxxton's employee says, "if anyone, including the federal government, is involved." "Sure," the other woman says. "The conspiracy goes straight to the top."<> <>"Right this way," your handler says and pushes the [[door open.|Conference Room Leave]]<>[[Listen.|Conference Room Stool]] [[Gurgle.|Conference Room Gurgle]]<> <><><><>

passages.name: Minnow Lure Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the lure [[in the pocket|Fishing Supplies]] of your slacks. <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Curling Iron Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the small curling iron [[in your jacket pocket.|Styling Supplies]] <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Curling Iron
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the curling iron  [[out of your jacket|Hair Treatments Busted]]     <>   A small tool for curling and crimping hair.    <>

passages.name: Costume Crook Fall
passages.text:
<>
A shepherd's crook falls off the track and clatters to the floor, leaving behind [[the shepherd's robes.|Costume Shepherd]] [[Back|Storage Sublevel]]

passages.name: Bounce Final
passages.text: \nThe Lower Level Sales Manager is [[too hot on your trail.|Front Counter Final]]\n

passages.name: Sporting Goods Bounce
passages.text: \nIt's a wasteland of mattresses and laminate furniture out there, and all the exits [[remain closely guarded.|Sporting Goods]]\n

passages.name: Hair Pick
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the hair pick  [[out of your jacket|Hair Treatments Busted]]     <>   A comb designed for especially long or dense hair.    <>

passages.name: Costume Shepherd
passages.text: <>The Shepherd from Beyond Costume        The ghostly white robes hang empty. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <><><><>

passages.name: Exam Room Locked Door
passages.text: <>Steel-Gray Door        This door leads back to the honeycomb of offices where Sunrise technicians are tinkering with New Shoes. [[Open the door.|Exam Room Door Open]] [[Peer under the door.|Exam Room Door Peer]] [[Listen at the door.|Exam Room Door Listen]] [[Back|Exam Room]] <><><>

passages.name: Yipp 7.2
passages.text: "Probably one of the failed prototypes. On the quest to perfect the shoe, there have been some really odd detours." [["But why? What's the ultimate goal of the New Shoe?"|Yipp 8]]

links.text: "But why? What's the ultimate goal of the New Shoe?"

passages.name: Yipp 7.1
passages.text: "I worked at Sunrise Developments during the New Shoe's initial design," she says. "We had a small facility near Highway 22. Braxxton’s understands the shoe's true power and was brought into the loop based on the leadership of Ken something, a particularly cold-hearted mid-level employee. The New Shoe needs a slow rollout, so your little store is ideal." [["I think I saw one of the shoes. It was behaving like a pack rat."|Yipp 7.2]]

links.text: "I think I saw one of the shoes. It was behaving like a pack rat."

passages.name: Elevator
passages.text: Pulleys squeal to accept your weight. [[Push B|Lower Level]]

passages.name: Yipp 4
passages.text: "Do you really think technology like that would be used for matching sneakers and t-shirts?" [["But think of the demand."|Yipp 5.1]] [["I don't know what to believe."|Yipp 5.2]]

passages.name: Yipp 6
passages.text: "I'm a just scientist who's tired of sitting on her hands," she says. "Extremely tired. The New Shoe is basically a mind control device, and with the correct interface, it can be used to control someone’s central nervous system and many of their thoughts. On a more subtle level, it can be used to influence someone into siding with a certain person or ideal." [["This is a lot to take in. How do you know what you're saying is true?"|Yipp 7.1]] [["You helped to create it."|Yipp 7.1]]

links.text: "This is a lot to take in. How do you know what you're saying is true?"

passages.name: Measuring Device
passages.text: <>   You hurl the measurer  [[at his head|Aisle Escape]]     <> <>   A heavy foot measuring device.    <>   You're going to hang onto it for now.    <> <>

passages.name: Yipp 2
passages.text: "You're probably wondering what this is about." [["I know about the New Shoe."|Yipp 3.1]] [["I have no idea."|Yipp 3.2]]

passages.name: Yipp 8
passages.text: "There are powerful forces at play," she says. "Wait. Are you still at the store? Are you calling from Braxxton's?" [["Yes."|Yipp 9.1]] [["No."|Yipp 9.2]]

passages.name: Take Bedazzled Shoe
passages.text: <> You narrow your search to two options remarkable for their tackiness: [[A big platform sandal (a right shoe) strung all over with charms|Take Bedazzled Shoe Right]] [[A slightly smaller thong sandal (a left shoe) covered in plastic stars|Take Bedazzled Shoe Left]] [[Don't take a shoe.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search]] <><> <><>You swap out the platform sandal, a right shoe, for the [[thong sandal, a left shoe.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search]]<><>You swap out the thong sandal, a left shoe, for the [[platform sandal, a right shoe.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search]]<><>

links.text: A big platform sandal (a right shoe) strung all over with charms
A slightly smaller thong sandal (a left shoe) covered in plastic stars

passages.name: Stock Room 2
passages.text:
<>
Stock Room
A row of [[boxes|Stock Room Boxes 2]] dead ahead contains a number of popular styles, and a [[flat space|Stock Room Loft 2]] above remains far out of your reach. To your right, you see the [[Sales Office door,|Stock Room Closed Door 2]] and to your left, a <>cobweb-covered [[mess of boxes.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Cobwebbed]]<><>[[pile of boxes.|Stock Room Jumble 2]]<><>[[pile of boxes.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search]]<> [[Vandar,|Stock Room Vandar 2]] standing next to the doorway that leads to the [[front counter,|Front Counter Room 2]] appears to be engrossed in a heated cell phone conversation. <><>"Those numbers are way low," he says. "Let me show you the new estimates I have from Sunrise."<><>"Look, pal, you don't have to talk to me like that," he says.<><>"To me, and this is some gut-level honesty, those in-store posters are crap," he says.<><>He combs his hair back and sighs. "Whatever," he says.<><>"Of course I trust you," he says. "This project has been murder on everyone involved, from day one."<><>"But we have to remove the stickers," he says.<><>"Yeah, we can insert the tongues if we need to," he says.<><>"No way, there are supposed to be fourteen young adult sizes," he says, "and fifteen children's."<><>"Coconut white," he says.<><>"We'll know much more after week one," he says. "We'll have so much data."<><>"What do you mean by 'recursive'?"<><>Other than the occasional expletive, you've given up on trying to make sense of what he's saying.<> <>[[Eavesdrop.|Stock Room 2]] <><><> <> <><><> <>

passages.name: Take Shopper Bag
passages.text: <>The bag [[makes a rustling sound.|Shopper Convo 2]] "Hands off," the woman says. "I'm going to need those in a second. They're fantastic for prying."<>You're [[no longer interested in collecting shoehorns.|Shopper Convo 2]]<>

links.text: no longer interested in collecting shoehorns.

passages.name: Use Fruit Cup
passages.text:
<><>
You shuffle over to a chair and page through a colorful magazine about trout fishing. After a short time, the secretary curses several times under her breath and storms off with the box. [[You carefully avoid eye contact.|Waiting Room]]

passages.name: Have Nothing
passages.text: Your pockets are empty.

passages.name: Bonnets Associate
passages.text: <>Sales Associate        His name tag says "Paul Quigley." "Can I help you with something?" [["Uh, no."|Bonnets and Brines]] [["Do you have apple cider vinegar?"|Bonnets Question]] <><><>

passages.name: Use Left Shoe
passages.text: \nThe creature inches closer to your outstretched hand with one hop, two hops, three hops, four. You stagger as the sandal slides out of your hand and onto the floor where a long, black appendage [[curls around it.|Use Left Shoe 2]]\n

passages.name: Front Counter
passages.text:
<>
Front Counter
Assorted shoe-related items, including spray deodorizers, fill the front counter's many drawers and cubbies. Out on the sales floor, crooked shoe shelves and trees extend outward until merging with the nearby clothing section, where they disappear. A doorway leads to the [[stock room,|Stock Room Intro]] and a path leads back [[down the central aisle.|Shopper Convo 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Empty Office Standing
passages.text:
<>
Empty Office
There are two chairs, an [[empty table,|Empty Table]] and a [[desk.|Empty Office Desk]] A [[gray door|Empty Office Door]] leads elsewhere, and multiple cables hang unplugged from a security camera in the corner. You're wearing [[New Shoes.|New Shoes]] <><><>

passages.name: Conference Room After Speech
passages.text:
<>
A pressure releases in your head. You can now look around the dingy conference room, where large black and white photographs of three generations of Betty J. Braxxton (I, II, III) hang from the walls. [[Look at the conference table.|Conference Room Look at Table]] [[Look at your handler.|Conference Room Look at Handler]] [[Turn around.|Conference Room Turn Around]]

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 2 Pronounce
passages.text:
<>
Here goes. "<>" <>[[More words, more words.|Conference Room Speech 3]]<>"Where is this coming from?" your handler whispers and jabs at something on his controller. [["OK, again."|Conference Room Speech 2]]<>

passages.name: Waiting Room Box
passages.text: <>Box        You tip-toe behind the secretary and look in the box. It's filled with photocopies of a technical report she hands to Sunrise engineers as they arrive for work. [[Take a copy.|Waiting Room Take Copy]] [[Back|Waiting Room]] <><><><>

passages.name: Stock Room Jumble 2
passages.text:
<>
Mound of Boxes
<>You peel off most of the icky webs, smoosh them into a ball, and stoop over. <><>The boxes all say, "Beach Rovers," in red type, the sandal brand you're looking for. [[Search for the sandal with blue butterflies.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Intro]] [[Leave the pile.|Stock Room 2]] <><><>

links.text: Search for the sandal with blue butterflies.

passages.name: Bare Room Blessed 4
passages.text: She moves around to the front of the desk. "I need you to help us find Maryann," she says, "by leading her to us. She's not who you think she is." [["Maryann who?"|Bare Room Blessed 5.1]] [["You can't make me."|Bare Room Blessed 5.2]]

passages.name: Sporting Goods Question
passages.text: <>He looks at your bulging pants. "Would you mind emptying your pockets?" he says. You pull out the small collection of fishing equipment and drop it onto the counter. "Were you going to pay for those, sir?" the associate says. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>He smiles and points. "Down there, take a right, and if you get to the fishing poles, you went too far." [["Thanks."|Sporting Goods]]<><>"Right down there," he says, pointing. "Hang a right at the deer urine." [["Thanks."|Sporting Goods]]<>

passages.name: Bare Room Blessed 1
passages.text: You sit down. She smiles at you. "During the language demonstration," she says, "I had no idea you were the same boy those guards had whacked over the head." She laughs. "You're a slippery fish to catch." She stands up from where she was leaning against the desk and slowly paces in front of the New Shoe poster. "Now that we have you," she says, "I'd like to treat you to something of a history lesson." She clears her throat and runs her finger over the New Shoe's jagged silhouette. "Did you know that in the history of the world, most societies have lived under brutal, tyrannical regimes?" she continues. "That free debate is only a modern development? A quirk? What if we found something we could agree upon?" [[You frown.|Bare Room Blessed 2]]

passages.name: Bare Room Blessed 2
passages.text: "Let me talk to both sides of the political game. I'll call it a game. Each has a number of prescribed solutions. And on the whole, they probably work. They would, if not for a missing condition. What do you think that is?" [["Hard work?"|Bare Room Blessed 3]] [["Money?"|Bare Room Blessed 3]]

passages.name: Bare Room Blessed 3
passages.text: "Control," she says. "Control takes policy out of the realm of the theoretical and into that of the experimental. If one could try a policy, any policy, taxing the rich, taxing nobody but the rich, awarding jobs by lot, mandating science education through age 25, if one could just try some things, we could get some answers and not just endless, circuitous debate. So." [["What do you want from me?"|Bare Room Blessed 4]]

passages.name: Front Counter Cubby
passages.text: <>Tub of Foot Measurers        There are about a dozen foot measuring devices in the tub, each made from a chrome-plated material similar to the shoehorns you found. [[Take one.|Take Foot Measurer First]] [[Back|Front Counter Room 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Yipp Final 3.1
passages.text: "Yes. Sunrise is run by my sister, Blessed. I don't have time to relate to you my entire family history. Let's just say it's been interesting. My sister is both brilliant and disorganized. She's a big-picture sort of person, and I was her counterpart, guiding her back to a more realistic and fashion-focused vision of what the New Shoe could be. But I couldn't control her. When she became enthralled with plans for world domination, I took off." [["She doesn't seem that dangerous."|Yipp Final 4.1]] [["I've already gotten the better of her once."|Yipp Final 4.2]]

links.text: "I've already gotten the better of her once."

passages.name: Yipp Final 3.2
passages.text: "Sorry," she says. "Blessed, my sister, owns and operates Sunrise. I don't have time to relate to you my entire family history. Let's just say it's been interesting. My sister is both brilliant and disorganized. She's a big-picture sort of person, and I was her counterpart, guiding her back to a more realistic and fashion-focused vision of what the New Shoe could be. But I couldn't control her. When she became enthralled with plans for world domination, I took off." [["She doesn't seem that dangerous."|Yipp Final 4.1]] [["I've already gotten the better of her once."|Yipp Final 4.2]]

links.text: "I've already gotten the better of her once."

passages.name: Stock Room Jumble 2 Cobwebbed
passages.text:
<>
Gauzy Mound of Boxes
A waist-high pile of shoeboxes lies covered in a tangle of cobwebs. [[Clear away the cobwebs.|Stock Room Jumble 2]] [[Leave the pile.|Stock Room 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Sandals Customer
passages.text: "I'm still looking," you say. [["Great," he says.|Beach Sandals Room]]

passages.name: Waiting Room
passages.text:
<>
Waiting Room
People with business to conduct in the administrative wing wait here on midcentury chairs before disappearing down a nondescript hallway. <>Normally, they gain admission by flashing credentials to a secretary seated at a plexiglass window, but she's not here at the moment. On her desk are a [[multi-line phone,|Waiting Room Phone]] a [[cell phone,|Waiting Room Cell Phone]] and a [[phone book.|Waiting Room Phone Book]] The entrance she normally tends to is guarded on the other side by two armed men.<>To get this far, they've had to flash credentials to a sidearm-packing secretary seated at a plexiglass window. A [[box of reports|Waiting Room Box]] sits at her feet, and her desk is equipped with a [[big phone,|Waiting Room Phone]] a [[cell phone,|Waiting Room Cell Phone]] and a [[phone book.|Waiting Room Phone Book]] The entrance she tends to is guarded on the other side by two armed men.<> [[A door|Storage Sublevel]] next to a bare female mannequin is labeled "Storage Sublevel," and footsteps echo down [[another hallway.|Bustling Hallway]] <><><><>

passages.name: Conference Room
passages.text:
<><>
Conference Room
You're standing at the head of a long table. Something stops you from looking at the dozen or so people seated around it. The Sunrise employee with the large controller is standing next to you. <>"It's demonstration time," he says. "Time to show you how far we've come in advancing the interface's language production capabilities."<><>"This young man, who put on the shoes quite recently, is going to tell us all about his 'subjective' experience as an Early Adopter of the New Shoe," he says.<><>"The controller I'm holding, which I'm sure you'll remember, will transmit phoneme bundles to his brain link, inducing speech," he says.<><>"Excited?" he asks the people seated around the table. [["Let's get started."|Conference Room Speech 1]]<> <>[[Wait.|Conference Room]]
<><><><>

passages.name: Stock Room Loft 2
passages.text: <>Stock Room Loft        A flat space high above eye level that's clearly inaccessible via any of the means available to you. [[Back|Stock Room 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Shopper Convo
passages.text:
<>
Mid-Aisle
"Watch yourself," the woman says and drops the plastic bag onto the floor. She turns back to the cart. The path continues on to the [[Shoe Dept.|Shopper Ladies Shoes]] [[Watch the woman.|Shopper Convo 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Sporting Goods Busted
passages.text: <>"I wanted to ask you about this <>," you say, but a small collection of fishing supplies falls out of your pocket and onto the floor. "Were you going to pay for those, sir?" the associate says. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>"I wanted to ask you about this <>," you say, but another item falls out of your pocket and onto the floor. "Were you going to pay for that, sir?" the associate says. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>"How much is this <>," you say. "All the items on that rack are $6.99, sir." the associate says. [["Thanks."|Sporting Goods]]<>

passages.name: Minnow Lure
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the lure  [[out of your pocket|Sporting Goods Busted]]     <>   A slender fishing lure with small hooks attached to its sides.    <>

passages.name: Costume Crook
passages.text: <>Shepherd's Crook        A curled staff for hiking and leaning on and whacking stubborn animals on the rump. [[Take it.|Costume Crook Take]] [[Back|Storage Sublevel]] <><><><>

passages.name: Cafeteria Man 1
passages.text:
<>
"I can see you, you know," he says. You've been staring. [["Do you work for Sunrise?"|Cafeteria Man 2.1]] [["Sorry."|Cafeteria Man 2.2]] [["Can I pet your dog?"|Cafeteria Man 2.3]]

passages.name: Cafeteria Man 3
passages.text: He nods. "On the whole, it ain't too bad," he says and stands up. "At least now I'm a free man." As he leaves, a group of brainy-looking Sunrisers sits down in the [[cafeteria.|Cafeteria]]

passages.name: Sales Manager Encounter
passages.text: \nYou almost collide with the Lower Lever Sales Manager, a gangly man with great knobby hands. One of them is clutching a large controller, and he [[chases after you,|Front Counter Final]] hoping to reactivate or tune down your shoes.

passages.name: Empty Office Standing Up
passages.text:
<>
\nYou take a deep breath and [[wobble to your feet.|Empty Office Standing Up 2]] Your limbs feel ungainly.

passages.name: Exam Room Door Listen
passages.text:
<>
You press your ear against the door and hear muffled voices. <>"Mmhmmm ... //ummhummm// ... mmm, Carolina, mmhmmmhm, Texas ..."<><>"eyyymm .. //mmhmm//, an ... //finish// with a, uhhh, mmmmmn //yes// ..."<><>"//Right// uhhumm, mmm .. //ahhhem//, neuro, unh-huh ... Korea ..."<><>"Stove an', mhmmmm, ports, //mmmmhmm// .... ah ..."<><>".. unhhh, //Florida//, ummhmm ... wonders and, uhhhhhnhhm ... yeah."<><>"Mmmhmmmhmhmmhmmmmummhumhmm ..."<> [[Keep Listening.|Exam Room Door Listen]] [[Hmm.|Exam Room Locked Door]]

passages.name: Training Convo 3.1
passages.text: <> "Vandar is an idiot, but I'll let you make up your own mind." [["I'm too young for that."|Training Convo 3.2]]

passages.name: Training Convo 3.2
passages.text: She laughs. "Oh yeah." You ask her to go on. "He's mostly a puppet for the Lower Level Sales Manager." [["What does he do?"|Training Convo 3.3]]

passages.name: Training Convo 3.3
passages.text: <><>"He's the main dude behind brokering the agreement with the New Shoe manufacturer. Ken is his name. Ken something." "And that was him in the Lower Level Sales Office?" you say. "Yep. Always in there making a racket." <><>You notice a man browsing in the Beach Sandals section.<><>Heather looks over her shoulder at a customer who's muttering to himself. It's the man looking at Beach Sandals.<><>The man in the Beach Sandals section has needed the help of a sales associate for quite some time.<> [["Can I try helping that guy?"|Beach Sandals]] <>[["This job is easy."|Training Convo 1.1]] [["How long have you worked here?"|Training Convo 2.1]]<><>[["This job is easy."|Training Convo 1.1]]<><>[["How long have you worked here?"|Training Convo 2.1]]<>

passages.name: Clothing Mirror
passages.text: They shake their heads. "All broken." You take up your <>cane<><>motorcycle helmet<><>handbag<> and follow the dog guy to the [[main elevator.|Elevator Final]] "Goodbye," he says and sprints back into the racks.

passages.name: Shopper Ladies Shoes
passages.text: <><>"Got to run, it's my first day," you say and trot up to the hulking [[front counter|Front Counter]] of the Shoe Dept., which carries mid-range footwear in all its forms: men's, women's, boots, sandals, slippers, and more. A mom and daughter brush past you as they're leaving.<> <>You return to the [[front counter.|Front Counter]]<>You return to the [[front counter.|Front Counter Room]]<><>

passages.name: Empty Office Door
passages.text: <>Gray Door        A plain, gray, windowless door. [[Open it.|Empty Office Door Open]] [[Back|Empty Office Standing]] <><><>

passages.name: New Shoes Untie
passages.text: \nThe knots are [[impossibly tight.|New Shoes]]\n

passages.name: Vandar Convo 3
passages.text: "That's not important." [["But what's the New Shoe?"|Vandar Convo 4]]

passages.name: Stock Room Loft
passages.text: <>Loft        A flat space high above eye level that's clearly inaccessible via any of the means available to you. [[Back|Stock Room]] <><><>

passages.name: Front Counter Room 2
passages.text:
<>
Front Counter
[[Heather|Heather Sandals]] is watching your customer in the [[Beach Sandals section|Beach Sandals Room]] but doesn't appear interested in helping you. Under the counter is a [[cubby that catches your eye.|Front Counter Cubby]] A doorway leads to the [[stock room.|Stock Room 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Yipp 9.1
passages.text: "I'm going to have to hang up now." [["Wait."|Yipp 10]]

passages.name: Yipp 9.2
passages.text: "You're lying. You don't grow up in a house like I did without learning to spot a liar." [[She hangs up.|Yipp 10]]

passages.name: Hospital 5
passages.text:
<html><style>#passages{background-color:#000000;margin-left:20%;}</style></html>
"No," you say, and a nurse looks over at you.

You crack the paperback's spine. The virus eats away at each sufferer's brain, reducing he or she to an infantile state, which only causes the person to eat more Kitties. By the time the last defenses fall, and darkness covers all, the human race is hugely sugared-up and honey-coated.

[[Shit.|Hospital 6]]

passages.name: Training Convo 1.2
passages.text: "You deal with it." [["I'm not the best at interacting with strangers."|Training Convo 1.3]] [["I don't know if I want to."|Training Convo 1.3]]

links.text: "I'm not the best at interacting with strangers."
"I don't know if I want to."

passages.name: Training Convo 1.3
passages.text: "You'll figure it out," she says and picks up a stray sneaker. <><>You notice a man browsing in the Beach Sandals section.<><>Heather looks over her shoulder at a customer who's muttering to himself. It's the guy looking at Beach Sandals.<><>The man in the Beach Sandals section has needed the help of a sales associate for quite some time.<> [["Should we help that man?"|Beach Sandals]] <>[["How long have you worked here?"|Training Convo 2.1]] [["How is Vandar, as a boss?"|Training Convo 3.1]] <>[["What does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Training Convo 3.3]]<><><>[["How long have you worked here?"|Training Convo 2.1]] <>[["What does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Training Convo 3.3]]<><><>[["How is Vandar, as a boss?"|Training Convo 3.1]] <>[["What does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Training Convo 3.3]]<><><><>[["What does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"|Training Convo 3.3]]<><>

links.text: "What does the Lower Level Sales Manager do?"

passages.name: Training Convo 1.1
passages.text: <> "Not all of the customers are a joy to interact with," she says. [["Then what?"|Training Convo 1.2]]

passages.name: Clothing Wandering Run
passages.text: You trip over a bullwhip and land splat in a puddle. As you get up, you realize you're shaking. "Running from a man with a gun?" the guy says. "Stick close. You won't find your way on your own, and neither will he." [[Follow along.|Clothing Wandering Follow]]

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 4
passages.text: Hmm. <> <> <> <> <> <> [[OK.|Conference Room Speech 4 Pronounce]]

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 3
passages.text: You're getting a headache. <> <> <> <> [[OK.|Conference Room Speech 3 Pronounce]]

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 2
passages.text: Clauses and half-thoughts compete for your attention. <> <> <> [[OK.|Conference Room Speech 2 Pronounce]]

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 1
passages.text:
<>
The words enter your mind, but something's wrong. Something's gotten mangled. You'll need to do some revisions before opening your mouth. <> <> <> [[OK.|Conference Room Speech 1 Pronounce]]

passages.name: Pass Out
passages.text:
<html><style>#passages{background-color:#000000;margin-left:20%;}</style></html>

<<timedcontinue 5s>>There's a rushing sound, and a soft redness floods into your vision.

<<timedcontinue 4s>>You feel sort of good.

<<timedcontinue 3s>>Your arm is moving.

<<timedcontinue 3s>>"Michael!" It's Heather.

<<timedcontinue 2s>>[[You open your eyes.|Pass Out 2]]

passages.name: Yipp 5.1
passages.text: "Yes, demand." She clears her throat. "If I was you, I would stay far away from that store." [["Why do you care?"|Yipp 6]]

passages.name: Yipp 5.2
passages.text: "Believe me when I say you should stay far away from that store." [["Why do you care?"|Yipp 6]]

passages.name: Hair Pick Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the hair pick [[in your jacket pocket.|Styling Supplies]] <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Lower Level Might Get Lost
passages.text: \nThe paths leading through the [[Lower Level's|Lower Level 2]] more untamed reaches are dangerously circular.

passages.name: Heather Final 2
passages.text: You bolt for the [[front counter,|Sales Manager Encounter]] and Heather jumps back. The elevator rattles. Someone's right behind you.

passages.name: Empty Office Standing Up 2
passages.text: \nYour left foot tingles and burns, and sharp pains stab at the base of your skull. Your thoughts slip away [[down aimless, meandering passages.|Empty Office Standing]]\n

passages.name: Desk Note 2
passages.text:
<>
\nYou realize that since you woke up, your tongue has [[gone numb.|Desk Note 3]]\n

passages.name: Desk Note 3
passages.text: \nRealizing this [[helps you to concentrate.|Empty Office Standing]] You can still walk OK, and your hands are starting to work better. Your sense of smell remains intact, and judging by the past twenty seconds, you can still muddle your way through complex thought.\n

passages.name: Bedazzled Shoe
passages.text: <>   Shaking a little, you  [[hold out the sandal|Use Left Shoe]]     <><>   Shaking a little, you  [[hold out the sandal|Use Right Shoe]]     <><>   An unattractive left shoe.    <><>   An unattractive right shoe.    <><>   Nope. You're going to have to find the matching shoe.    <><>   The size is already marked. It's a ten.    <><>   The size is already marked. It's a twelve.    <><>   This shoe is far more garish than anything you find on the shelves.    <><>   That doesn't work.    <><>   That doesn't work.    <>

passages.name: Pickling
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the jar of pickling brine  [[out of your handbag|Bonnets Busted]]     <>   A container of greenish fluid.    <>

passages.name: Hair Treatments Busted
passages.text: <>"I wanted to ask you about this <>," you say, but a small collection of styling supplies falls out of your jacket and onto the floor. "Were you going to pay for those, sir?" the associate says. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>"I wanted to ask you about this <>," you say, but another item falls out of your jacket and onto the floor. "Were you going to pay for that, sir?" the associate says. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>"How much is this <>," you say. "All the items on that rack are $5.75, sir." the associate says. [["Thanks."|Hair Treatments]]<>

passages.name: Shopper Stray Shoehorn
passages.text: <>Stray Shoehorn        There's a ripped price tag on one end. [[Take it.|Take Shoehorn]] [[Back|Shopper Convo 2]] <><><>

passages.name: Exam Room Stand
passages.text: \nYou jump [[down from the table.|Exam Room]]\n

passages.name: Waiting Room Phone
passages.text: <> You [[can't get close enough.|Waiting Room]] <> You [[don't trust|Waiting Room]] the company lines. <>

passages.name: Costume Cuttlefish
passages.text: <>Special Agent Squid Costume        You step back as the prosthesis wobbles into view. Below it hangs a simple black suit. [[Back|Storage Sublevel Control Box]] <><><><>

passages.name: Dial 9-1-1 2
passages.text: "Sir, I'm connecting you to the 24-Hour Mental Wellness Crisis Line." [["No, wait ..."|Waiting Room]] [["Um ..."|Waiting Room]]

passages.name: Shoehorn
passages.text: <>   Is this your idea of customer service?    <><>   Such drastic action doesn't yet feel unavoidable.    <><> <>  You jam the shoehorn under one of the wheels.    <><>   So shiny it doubles as an upside-down mirror.    <><>   You're going to keep that shoehorn in your pocket, where it belongs.    <>

passages.name: 9:00 Following Second Directions
passages.text: You recognize the red-haired nurse from your previous tour of the store. You're on the right track. After the Headboards and Hampers sub-dept., you come to an arch holding a sign, B AX TON’S, under which lies the [[entrance to the mall.|Mall Entrance]]

passages.name: Yipp Final 5
passages.text: "You can soon. Listen closely, Michael. There are a couple Clothing employees who can extend your shoe's transformative powers across all of your skin, turning you into something of a human chameleon. With a costume added, you'll be completely disguised. All they need is access to the Upsilon Controller." [["I can be anyone?"|Yipp Final 6.1]] [["Isn't this dangerous?"|Yipp Final 6.2]]

passages.name: Yipp Final 2
passages.text: She chuckles. "Sunrise is not quite so powerful as it thinks. Some of what they describe as the New Shoe's amazing powers will actually work. The rest will cause irreversible neurological damage, most likely over a period of months and years, just long enough for the shoe to spread far and wide and make Blessed Yipp one of the richest individuals on the planet." [["Yipp?"|Yipp Final 3.1]] [["When were you going to tell me you were related?"|Yipp Final 3.2]]

links.text: "When were you going to tell me you were related?"

passages.name: Outside 2
passages.text: \nThe men lead you around a dumpster, through a door, and down a clanking, beeping, scraping elevator. The air is cooler, like in a basement, when the guards finally [[snatch off your hood.|Bare Room]]\n

passages.name: Yipp Final 1
passages.text: "Hello?" you say. "So you made it to Clothing." It's Maryann. "And physically, you're OK?" "I think." "In that case, we need to get those shoes and especially that controller out of the mall. Sunrise only has power inside of those walls." [["The woman I met said they're bigger than the government."|Yipp Final 2]] [["Sunrise will hunt me down."|Yipp Final 2]]

links.text: "The woman I met said they're bigger than the government."

passages.name: Training Convo 2.2.5
passages.text: "Yep. I'm trying to get a job at the state highway department. Something salaried that has nothing to do with shoes." [["Where does all the random bric-a-brac come from?"|Training Convo 2.4]]

links.text: "Where does all the random bric-a-brac come from?"

passages.name: Heather Followup 2.1
passages.text: <> "Five years," she says, "time I'd rather have spent elsewhere." [["How else could you have applied yourself?"|Heather Followup 2.2]] [[Direct your attention elsewhere.|Front Counter Room 2]]

links.text: "How else could you have applied yourself?"

passages.name: Shopper Back Wheels
passages.text: <>Back Wheels        <>Two big wheels scuffed and roughed by years of abuse.<>A shoehorn remains jammed under one of the back wheels. [[Take back the shoehorn.|Take Back Shoehorn]]<> [[Back|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] <><><>

passages.name: Heather Followup 2.3
passages.text: "I'm trying to get a job designing highway overpasses. It's steady work, even if it's dull." [[Direct your attention elsewhere.|Front Counter Room 2]]

passages.name: Heather Followup 2.2
passages.text: "I wanted to become a bridge engineer, but nobody builds bridges anymore. Not in this country. Eight years of schooling down the drain." [["You couldn't engineer something else?"|Heather Followup 2.3]]

passages.name: Lead Weight Grab
passages.text:
<><>
\nYou stick the weight [[in the pocket|Fishing Supplies]] of your slacks. <>It's beginning to bulge.<><>It's now bulging greatly.<>\n

passages.name: Fishing Weight
passages.text: <> <><><><><>  You pull the weight  [[out of your pocket|Sporting Goods Busted]]     <>   A round piece of lead for weighing down a fishing line.    <>

passages.name: Hospital 6
passages.text:
<html><style>#passages{background-color:#000000;margin-left:20%;}</style></html>
You just realized something. You're going to have to find a new job.

Before your parents come to pick you up, you sit down with the yellow pages from the Patient Phone and flip through the landscaping services, hotels, and chain restaurants. Any place that will pay you, really. You stick a couple ripped pages in your pocket, and your fingers hit a card.

You know which, for a Sales Associate I. Completed training but never finished a full day. No call, no show on the second. Slow to perform tasks. Demonstrated a lack of familiarity with the stock room.

Maybe you'll [[do better next time.|End]]

passages.name: Front Counter Bounce
passages.text: "Where are you going?" Heather says. You [[turn around.|Stock Room]]

passages.name: Stock Room Vandar
passages.text: <>"Mr. Vandar?" you say. "You must be Michael," the man says and grimaces. Your coworker, whose name tag says Heather, is inspecting a red mark on his forehead. [["Yes, I am."|Vandar Convo 2]] <><>"Hurry, now," Vandar says. "Don't waste another second." [["Yes sir."|Stock Room]] <><>You start to say something but stop yourself. "Chop, chop," Vandar says. "Be on your way." [["Yes sir."|Stock Room]] <><><>"Ken!" Vandar yells and knocks on the door to the Lower Level Sales Office. It swings open, revealing a thin figure standing in near-darkness. "I thought I heard those wheels," [[this new man|Cart Completed]] says. "Yes. Bring them in here." "What do you say we keep this to ourselves?" Vandar says and helps Heather push the cart into the office, but Ken doesn't respond.<><>"Ask Heather to show you the basics," Vandar says. [["OK."|Stock Room]] <>

passages.name: Outside
passages.text: You roll into something hard, a leg belonging to a tall security guard. He's carrying a sub-machine gun and wearing blue jeans, a white t-shirt, and sunglasses. In fact, there are two of them standing over you. Without saying a word, they grab your shoulders and put a hood over your head. Quite pleasantly, it seems to be made of a hyper-breathable fabric. One of them calls a woman on the radio. "We've got the muskrat," the guy says. "Over by Shipping and Receiving. No indication how he got out of the rat hole. Yeah. We're [[headed down."|Outside 2]]

passages.name: Fruit Cup
passages.text: <>   You peel open the cup and  [[dump it inside|Use Fruit Cup]]     <> <>   A sealed cup of purple matter.    <>   You rather prefer hanging onto this cup.    <> <>

passages.name: Blessed Office Small Door Open
passages.text: \nYou're [[not close enough.|Blessed Office 2]]\n

passages.name: Dial Parents
passages.text: \nSeeing as you've never memorized the number for the unlisted defense contractor where they both work, [[you're going to have to look elsewhere for help.|Waiting Room Phone Book]]\n

links.text: you're going to have to look elsewhere for help.

passages.name: Empty Table
passages.text: \nYou run your hand over it. A small "Sunrise Systems" sticker, which features a logo of a glowing brain, has been <>[[slapped onto one end.|Empty Office]]<>[[slapped onto one end.|Empty Office Standing]]<>\n

passages.name: Beach Sandals 1.3
passages.text: "I see what you mean." The man, wearing an untucked dress shirt, holds up the sandal with butterflies. "Do you have a nine in this style?" he says. "I'm sure we do," Heather says. [["I'll get it," you say.|Beach Sandals Room]]

passages.name: Beach Sandals 1.2
passages.text: The guy shakes his head. "I really don't know what else to get her," he says and sits down on a stool for trying on shoes. [["Whenever I've received a gift, it was the thought behind it that counted the most."|Beach Sandals 1.3]] [[Look at Heather.|Beach Sandals 2.1]]

links.text: "Whenever I've received a gift, it was the thought behind it that counted the most."

passages.name: Beach Sandals 1.1
passages.text: The guy looks down and says, "Do you think my wife would like either of these sandals?" [["Does she wear shoes like that often?"|Beach Sandals 1.2]] [[Look at Heather.|Beach Sandals 2.1]]

links.text: "Does she wear shoes like that often?"

passages.name: Use Controller 2
passages.text:
<>
\nYou count off the seconds. Around 11 or 12, you [[feel free again.|Blessed Office 4]]\n

passages.name: Yipp 3.2
passages.text: "Do the words 'New Shoe' mean anything to you?" [["Yeah, they're shoes that change to match your attire."|Yipp 4]]

links.text: "Yeah, they're shoes that change to match your attire."

passages.name: Conference Room Speech 4 Pronounce
passages.text:
<>
Deep breath. "<>" <>The room erupts in applause, and your handler [[pats you on the shoulder.|Conference Room After Speech]]<>[["Redo, redo,"|Conference Room Speech 4]] your handler whispers.<>

passages.name: Bonnets Busted
passages.text: <>"I wanted to ask you about this <>," you say, but a small collection of brine jars rolls out of your handbag and onto the floor. "Were you going to pay for those?" says the associate. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>"I wanted to ask you about this <>," you say, but another jar rolls out of your handbag and onto the floor. "Were you going to pay for that?" says the associate. [["I have no money."|Police]]<><>"How much is this <>," you say. The associate seems intrigued by your voice. "All the items on that shelf are $4.50," he says. [["Thanks."|Bonnets and Brines]]<>

passages.name: Stock Room Closed Door 2 Peer
passages.text: \nYou try to peek under the door, but [[all you see is darkness.|Stock Room Closed Door 2]]\n

passages.name: Exam Room Sitting
passages.text:
<>
Examination Room
This room is like a cross between the world's smallest shoe store and a doctor's office. Shelves are jammed with a rainbow of shoe styles and colors and a wide selection of nylon socks. To the side, a pair of movable mirrors and a [[table|Exam Room Can't Reach]] heaped with controllers add to the clutter. Above, an extendable light angles down over the examination table where you're [[sitting.|Exam Room Stand]] [[One door|Exam Room Can't Reach]] leads to a busy hallway, and a [[second|Exam Room Can't Reach]] to the Sunrise-requisitioned sector of the administrative wing. <><><><>

passages.name: Clothing Leaving
passages.text: The two employees smile up at you. You feel ... different. "Yellow button," they say and hand you the controller. "Turn off." [["Mirror?"|Clothing Mirror]] [[Head upstairs.|Clothing Leaving 2]]

passages.name: Use Right Shoe
passages.text: \nThe creature moves toward you but [[shoots back into hiding.|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search]]\n

passages.name: Use Left Shoe 2
passages.text: \nYour mind reels with the shape of the thing. You think: Reptilian. A shoe designed to mold around the user's body and support the wearer's ankles and arches during athletic activity. A glistening ... [[tongue.|Use Left Shoe 2.5]]\n

passages.name: Use Left Shoe 3
passages.text: Vandar shouts into his phone: "I need to know more if I'm going to sell these things to actual customers. Are you hearing me? Hello?" And then, [[darkness.|Pass Out]]

passages.name: Shopper Cart Handle
passages.text: <>The woman coughs, and you [[slink back.|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]]<><><>You both lean into the cart [[but can't move it.|Shopper Convo 2 Cart]] "These things are even heavier than I thought," Heather says.<><><>You both lean into the squeaky cart and roll it back to the [[stock room.|Stock Room]]<><>

passages.name: Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Wait Intro
passages.text: <> <>As if driven by curiosity, the [[dark shape|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Wait]] (still carrying the butterfly sandal) bounces around to the front of the pile, traveling in a counterclockwise direction. You can't tell how it's holding onto the shoe.<>Here comes the [[shadowy shape|Stock Room Jumble 2 Search Wait]] again, bouncing around the pile in a counterclockwise direction.<>
